Senior or Principal Urban Designer (Band 6 or 7 considered)

Company Name Cardinia Shire Council Company Location Cardinia, AU

New Posted Date Posted 11 hours ago Number of views 1 view

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Band 7 or Band 6 will be considered depending on experience (Band 7 $92k - $112k, Band 6 $81k - $96k per annum plus Super and RDO)
  • 12 month maximum term contract role


We are looking for an experienced Urban Designer in the Strategic Planning and Urban Design Unit that will assist a dedicated team of professionals in defining the new growth areas and renewing the established areas of Cardinia Shire. You will play a key role in delivering an extensive urban design work program focussed on sustainable greenfield design and urban regeneration. An exciting opportunity is waiting for you, which offer variety, diversity and responsibility for the successful candidate in a progressive work environment.

To be successful in this role you will be an enthusiastic professional with good urban design skills. You will lead and assist in the delivery of urban design strategies and policies; public realm improvements; and urban design referral advice for development and capital works projects.

To be considered for the role you will also have great communications skills and be highly proficient in computer software such as AutoCAD, Adobe Creative Suite and Sketch Up. You will be a design graduate (preferably in Architecture and/or Urban Design) with over 2 – 3 years’ experience. The role has a focus on strategy development, including analysis and documentation and creating mapping, plans and visualisations.

People considering secondment opportunities between Local Governments are most welcome to apply.

The role is based at the Cardinia Civic Centre in Officer, Victoria, an exciting new workspace in the heart of one of Melbourne’s most dynamic and innovative municipalities. We are an organisation that embraces Activity Based Working, and as such we seek staff with demonstrated ability to show flexibility and adaptability in a work context. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to gender equity and our organisational values of Teamwork, Respect, Accountability, Communication and Customer Focus. Click HERE to read more about our Activity Based Working Environment and our state of the art new offices and benefits of working at Cardinia.

Why Cardinia?

Here are some reasons why people love it at Cardinia:
  • The people -we really live the values. We look out for each other (like a team) and we are genuine.
  • We work in the best workplace in local government – Activity Based Working – the office space and opportunities for just being you, and collaborative, are endless.
  • Lots of other perks; like health & wellbeing program, extensive professional development programs and support, and much more.
  • We embrace action oriented people who aren’t afraid to challenge the norm.
  • What we’re building in this shire exciting and will leave a legacy, and you get to directly influence it.
  • Our Leadership team are amazing - passionate as well as engaging and approachable.


For Further Details Download The Position Descriptions Below
  • Band 7 Principal Urban Designer - (Band rate between $92k - $112k per annum plus super and RDO)
  • Band 6 Senior Urban Designer - (Band rate between $81k - $96k per annum plus super and RDO)


or call 1300 787 624 and ask for Brooke Templeton - Coordinator Strategic Planning.

Apply using the online application form below, ensuring you upload your resume and cover letter.

Applications close Friday 26 October at 11:30pm.

Cardinia Shire Council is an Equal Opportunity and Child Safe employer who supports inclusiveness and diversity. We welcome applications from people from a diverse background, including but not limited to, those identifying as LGBTIQ, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander, people from cultural and linguistically diverse (CALD) backgrounds, and people with a disability.

903009279:
[

THE CLIFFORD CHAIR IN NEURAL ENGINEERING

Company Name University of Melbourne Company Location Parkville , Melbourne, VIC 3010, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 15 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

MELBOURNE SCHOOL OF ENGINEERING


Salary: Will be negotiated including base salary and additional research support plus 17% superannuation

The Clifford Chair
The Clifford Chair in Neural Engineering is an endowed Chair in the Melbourne School of Engineering at the University of Melbourne. Generous support and funding from the Clifford family, allows the Chair to develop a state of the art research group dedicated to neural engineering research and the support of a program in neural engineering. The Chair will work within the Department of Biomedical Engineering and the Graeme Clark Institute of Biomedical Engineering.


About Melbourne School of Engineering (MSE)
At MSE, we are committed to excellence. We are transforming our engineering and IT teaching as well as research at the University of Melbourne, guided by MSE 2025, our ten-year strategic plan. With an expected investment of $1 billion in people and infrastructure, we are creating the entrepreneurial leaders and technology of the future — the people and things that will drive innovation and productivity to make a sustainable impact on the world in which we live. It’s an incredibly exciting time to be joining MSE.


About the Department of Biomedical Engineering
The Department of Biomedical Engineering is a vibrant and rapidly growing department within MSE. We are working on some of the most challenging problems at the interface of engineering with life and medical sciences. The crux of this work being the application of interdisciplinary expertise and thought in order to make new discoveries and innovative solutions towards improved healthcare and social wellbeing. Our research covers the fields of biomaterials and tissue engineering; biomechanics and mechanobiology; bionics, biomedical imaging and neuroengineering; systems and synthetic biology. Our ultimate goal is to improve quality of life by resolving healthcare challenges.


About the Graeme Clark Institute
The vision of the Graeme Clark Institute is to shape the future of healthcare with biomedical engineering solutions that deliver health, societal and economic benefits to Australia and the world. The Institute is at the centre of the Melbourne Biomedical Precinct, a major global research and teaching powerhouse involving over 25 collaborators from health services, research and academic partners. It has unparalleled access to the clinical and research opportunities available across the entire network of partners. The strength of these partners, the relationships and existing collaborations, together with the proximity of the facilities provides unique opportunities to develop transformative health technologies.


The Opportunity
We seek an outstanding research leader as the Clifford Chair in Neural Engineering. Your leadership qualities will be utilised to develop and build our research program in neural engineering within a world-class biomedical precinct. As an established leader, you will have a distinguished scholarly research record and a renowned reputation in the field of neural engineering.

As a leader within our Graeme Clark Institute of Biomedical Engineering, you will demonstrate research excellence, provide leadership in the field amongst national and international peers, and represent the University in public debate as well as government policy development in neural engineering, neuroscience, and medical bionics.


Your Profile
You are an established Professor with demonstrated examples of successfully obtaining competitive research grants and experience in establishing and building high performing research teams whilst delivering excellent research outcomes.

You will bring with you your passion for neural engineering and a solid grounding in this field. You are innovative and have groundbreaking ideas to explore, as well as established contacts within the field.

With your outstanding communication skills and your commitment and dedication to your work, you will help drive outcomes within your teams. You are collaborative and seek out all opportunities to enhance your work through partnerships with end users, industry partners, clinicians and of course, our donors.


What we offer you
Apart from competitive salaries, our benefits are aimed at recognising and rewarding the contributions you make, including complete flexibility, whatever that may mean for you. Many of our benefit programs and onsite amenities are aimed at supporting you - including generous leave, child care subsidies, discounted parking, medical and health care. We also offer extensive opportunities for personal and professional development, as well as supporting you in doing what you love.


How to Apply

  • Apply online with a cover letter outlining your motivation and reasons for applying with a resume.
  • We ask that you please address the selection criteria for this position in a separate document.


About The University of Melbourne
The University of Melbourne is consistently ranked among the leading universities in the world, at number 1 in Australia and number 32 in the world (Times Higher Education World University Rankings 2017-2018). We are globally engaged, comprehensive, research-intensive, and committed to respond to the major social, economic and environmental challenges of our time.


While we take a look at your application, get to know us more and find out what it’s like working at MSE by visiting http://www.eng.unimelb.edu.au/about/join-mse/why-join-mse

The University of Melbourne and MSE are strongly committed to supporting diversity and flexibility in the workplace. Applications for part-time or other flexible working arrangements will be welcomed and will be fully considered subject to meeting the inherent requirements of the position.


Close date: 4 Nov 2018\xa0

\xa0


For full position information and to apply online go to:\xa0

http://jobs.unimelb.edu.au/caw/en/job/897761/the-clifford-chair-in-neural-engineering

Job description

L'Or\xe9al was founded by a scientist and we have always focused on cutting-edge research and innovation. Our innovation now also centers around the opportunity that the worldwide digital transformation provides and we are leaders in connecting beauty and technology.

Our business is energetic and vibrant, underpinned by strong ethical principles and our belief that financial performance and responsible business go hand-in-hand. We are driven each day by our six founding values - Passion, Innovation, Entrepreneurial spirit, Open-mindedness, Quest for excellence and Responsibility.

The mission of our Consumer Products Division is to provide the best innovation in beauty to consumers wherever and whenever they desire it. Through its brands L'Or\xe9al Paris, Maybelline, Garnier, NYX and essie, the division is focused on meeting the infinite beauty needs of all Australians. CPD team members are empowered and have shared ownership of business activities. The division also has a structure which encourages collaboration and cooperation between its different functions.

About The Role

Our Business Development team currently have an opportunity for a talented and upcoming category expert to join the team as a Category Manager. Putting your strategic category skills to work you will use your analysis and insight to bring strong category plans into fruition with our strategic retail partners. You will be working in conjunction with marketing, commercial, merchandising and the finance teams and you will have the ability to gain cross-functional knowledge and capabilities. In this role leading one of our key categories you will also:

Develop credible category relationships across all accounts, delivering valuable insights to help shape their growth plans, becoming the supplier of choice for projects and category reviews

Lead, inspire and develop an Assistant Category Manager

Drive improvements in the range review process, undertaking analysis and range/space evaluations to deliver recommendations for range and space

Provide advanced analytical data and rich insights to support marketing and sales functions on innovation decisions, sell in and launch platforms

Embed Category thinking within the division to drive consumer led plans and shopper led in store experiences

Develop an intimate knowledge of the competitive landscape and develop and deliver actionable recommendations and plans

Build relationships and leverage our international network to deliver global trends, insights, research and best in class 'in store Beauty' environments to inspire retailers

About You

To be successful in this role, you will have category management experience within a FMCG environment. A natural collaborator with a strong analytical mind-set you will be able to influence those around you to drive category growth. Possessing gravitas and strong communication skills you will be able to articulate a vision for the beauty categories at L’Or\xe9al. Your retailer focus will set you apart as will your conviction and resilience.

We are an equal opportunity employer and we encourage applications from people regardless of gender, ethnicity, religious beliefs or disability.

If you would like the opportunity to grow your career within a global, brand focused organisation, please apply.

Coordinator Social and Community Infrastructure

Company Name Knox City Council Company Location Knox, AU

New Posted Date Posted 9 hours ago Number of views 5 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Use your community and social infrastructure planning and place experience to help drive an integrated approach to developing, delivering and maintaining exceptional local community infrastructure for a changing community.

About Knox

Knox City Council aspires to be an organisation which is values based, empowers leaders, enables people to make a difference and has a culture of learning and high performance. Council believes that the values, attributes and skills that each staff member brings to the organisation underpin its culture, and will ultimately result in the achievement of Council’s Vision.

About The Team

The Social and Community Infrastructure Team is a new team within the Community Wellbeing Department. The Team supports Council through an integrated approach to develop community infrastructure plans and manage the development, monitoring, and compliance of relevant community facility licences and leases. The Team also identifies and informs current and future community service and facility needs so that Council can make well-informed decisions, deliver quality, flexible and responsive community infrastructure to support prosperous, liveable and sustainable communities in Knox.

About The Opportunity

The Coordinator Social and Community Infrastructure will manage a team to lead a cross-organisational, integrated and strategic approach to community infrastructure in Knox; will facilitate and participate in networks, partnership development and community engagement; will manage the development, monitoring and review of all Community Wellbeing leases and licenses; and project manage community service and infrastructure planning projects.

To be successful in this role, the Coordinator Social and Community Infrastructure will require:
  • A degree/diploma in Urban/Social Planning, Social Science or similar qualifications;
  • Demonstrated experience in managing and leading high performing teams;
  • Sound project management skills and experience in community services infrastructure planning;
  • Demonstrated understanding of integrated planning approaches at an organisational and community level; and
  • Experience in stakeholder engagement.

For further information, please see the position description, which includes the Selection Criteria required for your application, or contact Kathy Parton, Manager Community Wellbeing, on 03 9298 8541.

To Apply

Applicants for this role must submit a cover letter, resume and a response to the selection criteria as outlined in the position description, via the Knox City Council careers page. Applications close at 11:45pm AEST on Sunday 21 October.

Knox Council is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to providing a workplace that embraces diversity and inclusion. We are committed to a positive, barrier-free recruitment process. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application.

The role


An exciting opportunity is available for a driven sales professional to join Pickles as a Business Development Executive in our high performing sales team based in Altona North, Victoria.


In this role, your main responsibility will be driving sales growth by delivering superior customer service and building and maintaining long term business relationships. This will be generated from both existing and new vendors from an array of industries including the Transportation, Logistics, Construction, Civil, Equipment Hire & Agricultural sectors.


You will be primarily responsible for developing new business across Metropolitan and parts of Regional Victoria as well as managing a portfolio of existing vendors.


Being heavily involved in the end to end auction process and the management of vendors assets through their life cycle at Pickles. You will need to have an understanding of client needs and understand what service you can offer to maximise sales results by proactively identifying opportunities, conducting effective meetings and selling the right solutions from the range of Pickles services.


Who are we looking for?


  • An experienced business development and sales professional with a transportation, construction, earthmoving or agricultural equipment background.
  • High level interpersonal skills and ability to build and maintain relationships with clients
  • High customer service focus and time management skills
  • Proven experience in sales and business development
  • Strategic thinker & solution focused
  • Someone who thrives in a fast paced environment where they will be driving new business development and continuously looking for new business opportunities
  • Ability to work as part of a team as well as independently – you will be working closely with other departments to ensure assets are prepared for auction or sale in line with the sale calendar as well as working independently to source assets.
  • Experience with a Client Relationship Management system tracking sales activities and leads.
  • Solid knowledge of transport equipment, construction equipment & or earthmoving equipment is a significant advantage.



What are the benefits?


At Pickles, the opportunities are endless.


  • Opportunity to drive your own income with uncapped earning potential.
  • Rewarding careers in supportive and down to earth team environments
  • With a national footprint, ongoing learning and development opportunities with multiple channels of growth and promotion are always available for high performing employees
  • Collaborative, high performing and inclusive culture
  • Flexible and agile work practices
  • Auctioneer training


There will be a competitive salary package on offer including a commission structure with high earning potential. Tools of the trade will also be included; company car, mobile phone, laptop and company uniform.

At Foxtel, we’re bringing television to Australians like never before. Our mission is to provide Australia’s best value streamed and live sport, movies, drama, news and entertainment experience.

Your purpose

  • Act as the voice of Foxtel in the reactive social media space, supporting business goals and providing excellent customer service

Company Name Beacon Lighting Company Location Derrimut, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 19 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Join a highly successful retailer
  • Avoid inner-city traffic at our Derrimut location, with free on-site parking
  • Excellent benefits including competitive salary and generous staff discounts


About Us

Operating over 100 stores nationally and with offices located both east and west of Melbourne, Beacon Lighting is renowned as Australia’s leading specialist in developing, designing and distributing lighting, ceiling fans and globes. As the business continues to build on its success, E-Commerce has becoming increasingly important and we are embarking on an exciting digital transformation journey.

\xa0

The Role

We are seeking an experienced E-Commerce Systems Analyst to join the team located at Derrimut office. Acting as a coordination point between the IT team, the Marketing Team and external vendors, you will provide systems management and support of existing and new on-premise, cloud based and mobile applications. The role also needs you to be a technical lead in new and improvement projects. Key responsibilities of the role includes:

\xa0

Applications Support

  • Translate business requirements into technical and functional specifications to create SOW
  • Facilitate collaboration as required between system owners, and ensure good communication flows between the vendor/s
  • Work with the Learning and Development team to provide training for corporate applications
  • Investigate, troubleshoot and resolve application problems through to completion within the agreed SLA
  • Assist with identification of application integration requirements and dependencies for digital project plan
  • Work in conjunction with project manager to ensure project deliverables are met
  • Document application enhancement requirements, manage system releases and upgrades including creating and maintaining test plans, scripts and test outcomes (in collaboration with system owners and key users)
  • Participate in the development and review of policies and processes relating to the support of applications


Vendor/Contract Management

  • All aspects of contract management in relation to key software application contracts
  • Ensure the efficient and resilient operation of the organisation’s suite of applications including management of appropriate maintenance contracts
  • Work with external vendors and internal stakeholders to establish enforceable SLAs with all key vendors (existing and future)
  • Monitor performance against SLAs and utilise enforcement provisions of the contract effectively to improve performance
  • Assist in contract establishment for new systems, considering lessons learned in past contract management experiences
  • Assist system owners in developing business cases for relevant information technology projects


About You

To be successful in this role you will possess the following qualifications, skills and experience:

  • Extensive experience as an Applications Systems Analyst and/or similar position
  • Expertise and demonstrated success in managing multiple vendors including contracts, SLAs and relationships
  • Understanding of processes within the Software Development Lifecycle
  • Applied working knowledge and understanding of Project Management Framework
  • Experience in working with Magento E-Commerce platform
  • Exposure to Agile methodology
  • Experience in Software testing including UAT, integration and regression testing
  • Familiar with SQL Queries


Benefits

In return you will enjoy working in a business with a great culture, be rewarded with opportunities to further develop your skills, and receive a competitive salary package. \xa0We offer amazing staff discounts on all our products and free on-site parking.

\xa0

Click on 'Apply Now' and follow the process to complete your application. Include an up to date resume and cover letter explaining how you meet the key criteria outlined in this advertisement.

  • Actively contribute to streamline and improve processes that contribute to continuous improvement of the organization
  • Maintain warehouse and work areas in clean and safe manner and in accordance with company OH&S
  • Performs various warehouse and shipping tasks, as required
  • Assist with Inwards Goods when necessary
  • Pulls product to fill customer orders while verifying the accuracy of the picking and packing slips.
  • Weighs packages and puts shipping and tracking labels on packages which correspond with the shipment method of the order.
  • Perform any other warehouse associated task as required

KRA

Objective

KPI

Smooth and Efficient Warehouse Operation -- Working smarter and delighting our customers.

Accuracy & Timeliness of dispatching goods to our customers

Goods dispatched same day for all orders processed before 3 pm

< TBA Dispatch errors per month

>TBA% DOFR

Manage inventory accuracy by completing rolling cycle counts according to cycle count timetable

< TBA% variation on cycle counts

< Mandatory 2 full cycle counts per year

Warehouse organised and tidy

< Inspection 1st working day of every month (Warehouse Scorecard)

Utilise the most cost-effective freight method to send goods to our customers

< Freight costs to be less than TBA% of sales

Initial Expected Outcomes

3 Months

Able to work autonomously picking and packing orders

Able to prepare consignments notes and manifest

Have a good understanding of where products are located in the warehouse

Able to check off incoming goods from suppliers

6 Months

Have a good understanding of how to use business systems and follow company procedures

Ability to organise overseas shipments

Actively contributing to warehouse team meetings

Able to confidently navigate your way around Oracle

9 Months

Working with a high level of accuracy, speed, and confidence

Actively contributing & initiating improvements

12 Months

Confidently completing role without supervision

Skills, Competencies, And Behaviours
  • Demonstrated experience working in a warehouse role, with competence in using warehouse equipment such as barcode scanner and forklift.
  • Strong planning skills, with the ability to effectively organise products within the warehouse so that it can be easily stocked, monitored and retrieved as required.
  • Strong communication skills and provide clear instructions using a variety of different mediums, including; phone, written, e-mail.
  • Demonstrates a high level of attention to detail, ensuring a high degree of accuracy.
  • The ability to prioritize and coordinate multiple tasks simultaneously, in order to achieve required deadlines.
  • A working knowledge of MS Excel, MS Word, and Oracle with processing customer orders.
  • Highly motivated and energetic with a commitment to working both individually and in a team environment, and happy to assist other work colleagues as required.
  • Analytical skills, including the ability to identify improvements in warehousing processes and procedures.
  • Ability to verbally communicate effectively with others.
  • Ability to work effectively as a team member to achieve goals.
  • Must be able to work under strict time constraints and meet deadlines in a timely manner.
  • Demonstrated computer skills preferably spreadsheets, word processing, database and other applicable software programs

Essential Functions Performed
  • Coordinates the work responsibilities for the Material Handlers, and ensures the proper and efficient completion of assignments and processes.
  • Assists with interviewing job applicants.
  • Provides Supervisor employee performance information for their evaluation process and assist with the performance review.
  • Trains Material Handlers regarding job responsibilities.
  • Problem solves clean room issues by locating work orders and parts and responding to paperwork questions and concerns.
  • Makes minor adjustments to work order pick lists.
  • Works with the Production and Inventory Clerk teams to verify pick lists, lot numbers, and materials inventory counts.
  • Notifies Planning, Purchasing, and Production of material shortages and responds to adjustments in production schedules.
  • Organizes and participates in team meetings.
  • Compiles and records data for team goals and manage distribution.
  • Operates forklifts, order pickers, and other warehouse equipment.
  • Performs cycle counts and inventories for raw materials.
  • Performs other related duties and tasks as required.

COMMENTS

Infectious Control Risk Category III

The risk category explains whether or not employees are likely to come into contact with blood or body fluids while performing their jobs. Risk category III states employment and procedures that do not require exposure.
